result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 2/01/2016 along with DNA costs. Alternate 14 days jail.

Credit for TIME SERVED.
Court grants 2 days credit.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel J Ward in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and count 2 is dismissd and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:


2 days jail and with credit for time served
Fine $505.00
DNA Surcharge  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month commencing 02/01/2016 or alternate 14 days jail.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Daniel J Ward in court. Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for 60 days and then have the matter set for plea and sentencing. Court grants. Pleas and sentencing 12/21/2015 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Daniel J Ward in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as she does not have Discovery. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel J Ward
Current: 1325 Pewaukee Road, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 08-14-2015)
Prior: 120 Cambridge Ave,#305, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant to have no contact with witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Daniel J Ward in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a non collect phone call.  
  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
